sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Computes the error function for real arguments. The erf function takes only a single argument y = erf(x) where x is either a float or double array. The output vector y is the same size (and type) as x.

sect1.title: Internals
sect1.para: The erf function is defined by the integral: \[ \mathrm{erf}(x) = \frac{2}{\sqrt{\pi}}\int_{0}^{x} e^{-t^2} \, dt, \] and is the integral of the normal distribution.

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: Here is a plot of the erf function over the range [-5,5].
